First, we need to find a 'suitcase', which is an object. Therefore, we can eliminate all the 'room' options from our list. This leaves us with the options of 'object_19', 'object_20', 'object_21', 'object_22', 'object_23', 'object_24', 'object_36', 'object_43', 'object_52', and 'object_76'.

Next, we look at the 'class_' attribute of each object to see if any of them are a 'suitcase'. None of the objects in the list are classified as a 'suitcase'. 

Therefore, we need to move to another room to continue our search. We should choose the room that is closest to our current location to minimize the path length. Looking at the 'location' attribute of the rooms, 'room_9' seems to be the closest to our current location.

So, our choice would be 'room_9'. 

{'choice': 'room_9'}

The task is to find an object in the category 'suitcase' with the shortest path possible. Looking at the list of neighbors, 'object_6' is of class 'suitcase'. Therefore, it is the target object. There is no need to move to another room as the object is in the current room. Hence, the next place to go is 'object_6'. 

{'choice': 'object_6'}
